work.name: Scientific Computing and Imaging Institute, University of Utah
work.summary: Working as a Ph.D. student advised by Prof. Bei Wang Phillips. My research interests lie on topological data analysis and scientific visualization, and their applications to domain science.

education.institution: Kahlert School of Computing, University of Utah

publications.name: Distributed Augmentation, Hypersweeps, and Branch Decomposition of Contour Trees for Scientific Exploration
publications.publisher: IEEE Transactions on Visualization and Computer Graphics
publications.summary: Introducing distributed algorithms on distributed hierarchical contour trees for simplification, enabling efficient scientific exploration.

publications.name: Comparing Morse Complexes Using Optimal Transport: An Experimental Study
publications.summary: Introducing comparative measures based on optimal transport for Morse complexes.

publications.name: Sketching Merge Trees for Scientific Visualization
publications.summary: Combining matrix sketching techniques with merge trees for applications such as finding representatives for ensemble data and data clustering.
